rsLfapMIB.name: rsLfapMIB

revisions.description: Indicate rsLfapServerStaticLastChanged, rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt and rsLfapStatsLostAt are not supported in LFAPv4 in rsLfapAgentCompliance.

Add these objects MsgsUnknownTx, DropsInTxQueueWhenUp, MsgsInRxQueue, InvalidMsgsRx, MsgsUnknownRx into the StatsTable. Rename QueueDrops to DropsInTxQueue, LostPackets to TxLostPackets, LostOctets to TxLostOctets, QueuePeak to InTxQueuePeak. Changed the descriptions of the textual conventions and many of the objects. Rename ServerStatsTable to StatsTable.

Receive comments from Mike MacFaden and Sethu Rao. Change the object identity of the traps to be v1 compliant. Change the previous revision comments. Make rsLfapActiveServer a scalar. Rename rsLfapStaticServerTable to rsLfapServerStaticTable. The objects in that table have also been renamed appropriately.
MOve the scalars under rsLfapPerMon to a new table. rsLfapStatsTable. Add comformance. Reorganize tree. Rename some object identifiers.

Second round of edits from Paul Calato, Chiou-Hao Hsu. add both send and receive counters, add new counter for any unknown message types, clarify what lost timestamp counters and make MIB module support both implementation at CCE and FAS
First round of edits from Paul Calato.
Initial version of of Riverstone Flow Accounting MIB module for LFAPv4.

rsLfapMIB.contactinfo: Riverstone Networks, Inc 5200 Great America Parkway Santa Clara CA USA 95054 PHONE:+1 408.878.6500 EMAIL: nms-eng@riverstonenet.com WEB: http://www.riverstonenet.com
rsLfapMIB.description: This MIB module defines the enterprise protocol Lightweight Flow Accounting Protocol. It provides the following capabilities: 1. Report general LFAP connection state on the equipment, which would be called Connection Control Entity (CCE). 2. Report and configure LFAP agent. 3. Report and configure an external server, which would be called Flow Accounting Service (FAS). 4. Provide LFAP statistics per FAS. Copyright (C) Riverstone Networks, Inc 2001

RSLfapErrorCode.name: RSLfapErrorCode
RSLfapErrorCode.description: This represents the error states that can be detected by the LFAP agent on the the equipment or the CCE.

RsLfapServerInst.name: RsLfapServerInst
RsLfapServerInst.description: This number represents an external LFAP server (FAS) in the list of LFAP servers configured on the CCE. If the value is 0, then no FAS is indicated.

RsTaskPriority.name: RsTaskPriority
RsTaskPriority.description: This represents the relative priority of the LFAP agent to other tasks which shares CPU resources with the LFAP agent on the CCE.

RSOperState.name: RSOperState
RSOperState.description: This represents the operational state of the LFAP agent running on the CCE.

rsLfapCapabilities.name: rsLfapCapabilities
rsLfapCapabilities.description: The capabilities of the LFAP agent on the equipment (CCE). The LFAP agent is a LFAP client.

rsLfapAdminState.name: rsLfapAdminState
rsLfapAdminState.description: The administrative status of LFAP agent on the CCE. The value true would start the LFAP agent. And false would stop the LFAP agent.

rsLfapOperState.name: rsLfapOperState
rsLfapOperState.description: The operational state of the LFAP agent on the CCE.

rsLfapLastError.name: rsLfapLastError
rsLfapLastError.description: Current error status detected by the LFAP agent on the CCE.

rsLfapLastErrorReason.name: rsLfapLastErrorReason
rsLfapLastErrorReason.description: Current error reason detected by the LFAP agent on the CCE. This string is suitable for display to an operator.

rsLfapActiveServer.name: rsLfapActiveServer
rsLfapActiveServer.description: This indicates which FAS is connected to the LFAP agent on the CCE.

rsLfapPollInterval.name: rsLfapPollInterval
rsLfapPollInterval.description: The rate to send accounting information to the FAS by the LFAP agent.

rsLfapBatchSize.name: rsLfapBatchSize
rsLfapBatchSize.description: The number of records sent per batch to the FAS.

rsLfapBatchInterval.name: rsLfapBatchInterval
rsLfapBatchInterval.description: The time in seconds to send flow-create and flow-delete information to the FAS server.

rsLfapLostContactInterval.name: rsLfapLostContactInterval
rsLfapLostContactInterval.description: Amount of time to wait before considering the TCP connection lost.

rsLfapServerRetryInterval.name: rsLfapServerRetryInterval
rsLfapServerRetryInterval.description: The rate at which to retry a connection to a FAS.

rsLfapMaxTxQueueSize.name: rsLfapMaxTxQueueSize
rsLfapMaxTxQueueSize.description: Number of messages that can be queued for transmit before messages are dropped.

rsLfapTaskPriority.name: rsLfapTaskPriority
rsLfapTaskPriority.description: This helps a task scheduler on the CCE in scheduling the LFAP agent relative to other tasks on the CCE.

rsLfapServerStaticLastChanged.name: rsLfapServerStaticLastChanged
rsLfapServerStaticLastChanged.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time of the last change to any field or row in the rsLfapServerStaticTable.

rsLfapServerStaticTable.name: rsLfapServerStaticTable
rsLfapServerStaticTable.description: This table is used to configure FAS server(s) on the CCE.

rsLfapServerStaticEntry.name: rsLfapServerStaticEntry
rsLfapServerStaticEntry.description: Each entry would represent the configuration of an external FAS on the CCE. Rows added to this table persist across system restarts.

rsLfapServerStaticIndex.name: rsLfapServerStaticIndex
rsLfapServerStaticIndex.description: A unique value to index each LFAP server instance defined in this table.

rsLfapServerStaticAddressType.name: rsLfapServerStaticAddressType
rsLfapServerStaticAddressType.description: The type of address found in rsLfapServerStaticAddress

rsLfapServerStaticAddress.name: rsLfapServerStaticAddress
rsLfapServerStaticAddress.description: The IP address of a system acting as a FAS

rsLfapServerStaticStatus.name: rsLfapServerStaticStatus
rsLfapServerStaticStatus.description: Install and delete rows in this table using this object.

rsLfapStatsTable.name: rsLfapStatsTable
rsLfapStatsTable.description: This table contains one row per FAS server.

rsLfapStatsEntry.name: rsLfapStatsEntry
rsLfapStatsEntry.description: On the CCE, each entry contains LFAP statistics collected by the LFAP agent relating to a FAS. Each entry is indexed by the FAS server index (rsLfapServerStaticIndex).

rsLfapStatsSessionUp.name: rsLfapStatsSessionUp
rsLfapStatsSessionUp.description: The current state of the TCP connection between the LFAP agent on the CCE and an external server (FAS) identified by rsLfapServerStaticIndex. If a connection from the CCE is established with the FAS, then its value would be true. Otherwise it would be false.

rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt.name: rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt
rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt.description: The value of sysUpTime when rsLfapStatsSessionUp last changed state.

rsLfapStatsTcpConnects.name: rsLfapStatsTcpConnects
rsLfapStatsTcpConnects.description: This is the number of successul TCP connections the LFAP agent made to a FAS.

rsLfapStatsTcpConnectFails.name: rsLfapStatsTcpConnectFails
rsLfapStatsTcpConnectFails.description: This is the number of FAILED TCP connections the LFAP agent made to connect to a FAS.

rsLfapStatsTxVRs.name: rsLfapStatsTxVRs
rsLfapStatsTxVRs.description: This object contains the number of Version Request(VR) sent by the CCE to a FAS.

rsLfapStatsTxVRAs.name: rsLfapStatsTxVRAs
rsLfapStatsTxVRAs.description: This object contains the number of Version Request Acknowledge (VRA) sent.

rsLfapStatsTxFARs.name: rsLfapStatsTxFARs
rsLfapStatsTxFARs.description: This object contains the number of Flow Activation Records (FAR) sent. TBD: specify ref clause.

rsLfapStatsTxFUNs.name: rsLfapStatsTxFUNs
rsLfapStatsTxFUNs.description: This object contains the number of Flow Update Notification (FUN) sent.

rsLfapStatsTxARs.name: rsLfapStatsTxARs
rsLfapStatsTxARs.description: This object contains the number of Administrative Request(AR) sent.

rsLfapStatsTxARAs.name: rsLfapStatsTxARAs
rsLfapStatsTxARAs.description: This object contains the number of Administrative Request Acknowledge (ARA) sent.

rsLfapStatsMsgsInTxQueue.name: rsLfapStatsMsgsInTxQueue
rsLfapStatsMsgsInTxQueue.description: This object contains the number of messages currently in the send queue.

rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueue.name: rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueue
rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueue.description: This object represents the number of messages dropped by the LFAP agent in the transmitting queue for this FAS.

rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueueWhenUp.name: rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueueWhenUp
rsLfapStatsDropsInTxQueueWhenUp.description: This object represents the number of messages dropped by the LFAP agent in the send queue for this FAS while the connection between the CCE and the FAS is up.

rsLfapStatsRxVRs.name: rsLfapStatsRxVRs
rsLfapStatsRxVRs.description: This object contains the number of VRs received.

rsLfapStatsRxVRAs.name: rsLfapStatsRxVRAs
rsLfapStatsRxVRAs.description: This object contains the number of VRAs received.

rsLfapStatsRxFARs.name: rsLfapStatsRxFARs
rsLfapStatsRxFARs.description: This object contains the number of FARs received.

rsLfapStatsRxFUNs.name: rsLfapStatsRxFUNs
rsLfapStatsRxFUNs.description: This object contains the number of FUNs received.

rsLfapStatsRxARs.name: rsLfapStatsRxARs
rsLfapStatsRxARs.description: This object contains the number of ARs received by the CCE from a FAS.

rsLfapStatsRxARAs.name: rsLfapStatsRxARAs
rsLfapStatsRxARAs.description: This object contains the number of ARAs received.

rsLfapStatsMsgsInRxQueue.name: rsLfapStatsMsgsInRxQueue
rsLfapStatsMsgsInRxQueue.description: This object contains the number of messages currently in the receive queue.

rsLfapStatsInvalidMsgsRx.name: rsLfapStatsInvalidMsgsRx
rsLfapStatsInvalidMsgsRx.description: This object is the sum of corrupt and erroneous messages received.

rsLfapStatsMsgsUnknownRx.name: rsLfapStatsMsgsUnknownRx
rsLfapStatsMsgsUnknownRx.description: This object contains the number of unknown LFAP message types received.

rsLfapStatsTxLostPackets.name: rsLfapStatsTxLostPackets
rsLfapStatsTxLostPackets.description: The count of packets not accounted for and thus not recorded by the LFAP server.

rsLfapStatsTxLostOctets.name: rsLfapStatsTxLostOctets
rsLfapStatsTxLostOctets.description: The count of octets not accounted for and thus not recorded by the LFAP server.

rsLfapStatsLostAt.name: rsLfapStatsLostAt
rsLfapStatsLostAt.description: On the CCE, the sysUpTime when the LFAP agent last lost trasmitted FAR/FUN messages. On the FAS, it would be the last time when the server lost received FAR/FUN messages.

rsLfapStatsActiveFlows.name: rsLfapStatsActiveFlows
rsLfapStatsActiveFlows.description: Number of active flows being tracked per FAS.

rsLfapStatsFlowRate.name: rsLfapStatsFlowRate
rsLfapStatsFlowRate.description: Number of flows being setup per second. This value is calculated as an exponentially decaying average over 30 second intervals

rsLfapStatsActiveFlowsPeak.name: rsLfapStatsActiveFlowsPeak
rsLfapStatsActiveFlowsPeak.description: High water mark for number of active flows being tracked by LFAP.

rsLfapStatsMsgsInTxQueuePeak.name: rsLfapStatsMsgsInTxQueuePeak
rsLfapStatsMsgsInTxQueuePeak.description: High water mark for queue depth.

rsLfapStatsFlowsPeakTime.name: rsLfapStatsFlowsPeakTime
rsLfapStatsFlowsPeakTime.description: The value of sysUpTime when max number of flows being reported on was reached.

rsRunLfapSelfTest.name: rsRunLfapSelfTest
rsRunLfapSelfTest.description: When set to true, CCE performs self diagsnostic of accounting subsystem. Requires rsLfapAdminState to be set to false. Upon completion, rsLfapLastError will indicate test results.

rsLfapNoServer.name: rsLfapNoServer
rsLfapNoServer.description: The LFAP agent or a LFAP client has tried to connect to all servers in rsLfapStatsServerStaticTable and has failed.

rsLfapLostMessage.name: rsLfapLostMessage
rsLfapLostMessage.description: When a LFAP client first drops messages due to no connected server, send this event. No additional events are sent until the value of rsLfapStatsSessionChangedAt value has changed.

rsLfapQueueFull.name: rsLfapQueueFull
rsLfapQueueFull.description: Accounting data may be lost when the CCE queue reaches capacity. rsLfapStatsSessionUp indicates the typical case where there the connection to a FAS is lost. A second case is where the rate of inserts into the queue exceeds the rate at which the FAS is processing them. This can be caused by flow control of the underlying TCP session. Send only one rsLfapStatsQueueFull notification per 1000 messages.

rsLfapAgentCompliance.name: rsLfapAgentCompliance
rsLfapAgentCompliance.description: This compliance statement for implementing this MIB on the CCE. Some objects also do not need to be implemeted if the LFAP agent is v4.

rsLfapServerCompliance.name: rsLfapServerCompliance
rsLfapServerCompliance.description: This compliance statement for implementing this MIB on a FAS. Some objects in rsLfapStatsGroup would not apply to the FAS. TBD.

rsLfapAgentStateGroup.name: rsLfapAgentStateGroup
rsLfapAgentStateGroup.description: The collection of objects used to represent the desired and actual state of the LFAP agent.

rsLfapAgentCfgGroup.name: rsLfapAgentCfgGroup
rsLfapAgentCfgGroup.description: The collection of objects used to represent the configuration of the LFAP agent.

rsLfapServerStaticGroup.name: rsLfapServerStaticGroup
rsLfapServerStaticGroup.description: The collection of objects used to represent the configuration of a LFAP server.

rsLfapStatsGroup.name: rsLfapStatsGroup
rsLfapStatsGroup.description: The collection of objects used to represent the statistics of a LFAP server.

rsLfapDiagGroup.name: rsLfapDiagGroup
rsLfapDiagGroup.description: The collection of objects used to represent LFAP diagnostics.

rsLfapNotificationGroup.name: rsLfapNotificationGroup
rsLfapNotificationGroup.description: The collection of notifications for RS LFAP MIB.
